revised_title: Development of the Retinotectal Map in Xenopus Laevis
tldr: The authors studied the development of the retinotectal projection in Xenopus laevis larvae using electrophysiological mapping. They found that the visual map on the tectum of tadpoles differs from that in adults, with a progressive shift of the retinotectal projection during development. This research provides insights into the formation of nerve connections in the visual system of amphibians.
